metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9263 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Open vSwitch (OvS) 2.7.0, while parsing an OpenFlow role status message,there is a call to the abort() function for undefined role status reasonsin the function `ofp_print_role_status_message` in `lib/ofp-print.c` thatmay be leveraged toward a remote DoS attack by a malicious switch.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9263` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
openvswitch-ipsec - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
openvswitch-pki - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
openvswitch-switch - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
openvswitch-test - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
openvswitch-vtep - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
ovn-central - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
ovn-common - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
ovn-host - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
python-openvswitch - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
